com.github.triceo.splitlog

Interface CommonFollower

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    Follower, MergingFollower

    public interface CommonFollower
    Follower's primary function is to allow users to work with their portion of the tailed log file. It provides means for a blocking wait for particular chunks, and can also send these chunks to output. Messages get into the follower when LogWatch notifies it of them.

    • Method Detail

      • getMessages

        SortedSet<Message> getMessages()
        Retrieve messages that this follower has been notified of, including tags. They will appear in the order in which we have been notified of them.
        Returns:
        Messages we have been notified of.

      • getMessages

        SortedSet<Message> getMessages(MessageComparator order)
        Retrieve messages that this follower has been notified of, including tags, in a given order.
        Parameters:
        order - The comparator that will be used to order the messages.
        Returns:
        Messages we have been notified of.

      • getMessages

        SortedSet<Message> getMessages(MessageCondition condition,
                             MessageComparator order)
        Retrieve messages that this follower has been notified of, if a certain condition holds true for them, including tags. They will be in the order in which we have been notified of them.
        Parameters:
        condition - The condition.
        order - The comparator that will be used to order the messages.
        Returns:
        Messages we have been notified of, for which the condition holds true.

      • getMessages

        SortedSet<Message> getMessages(MessageCondition condition)
        Retrieve messages that this follower has been notified of, if a certain condition holds true for them, including tags. They will be in the order given.
        Parameters:
        condition - The condition.
        Returns:
        Messages we have been notified of, for which the condition holds true.

      • tag

        Message tag(String tagLine)
        Mark the current location in the tail by a custom message. In case the messages before and after the tag should be discarded in the future, the tag should still remain in place - this will give users the notification that some messages had been discarded. Please note that the current location is indicated by messages that are MessageDeliveryStatus.INCOMING. If a tag is placed after such message is created and the message only becomes MessageDeliveryStatus.ACCEPTED later, the tag will still follow.
        Parameters:
        tagLine - Text of the message.
        Returns:
        The tag message that was recorded.

      • waitFor

        Message waitFor(MessageDeliveryCondition condition)
        Will block until a message arrives, for which the condition is true.
        Parameters:
        condition - Condition that needs to be true for the method to unblock.
        Returns:
        Null if the method unblocked due to some other reason.

      • waitFor

        Message waitFor(MessageDeliveryCondition condition,
              long timeout,
              TimeUnit unit)
        Will block until a message arrives, for which the condition is true. If none arrives before the timeout, it unblocks anyway.
        Parameters:
        condition - Condition that needs to be true for the method to unblock.
        Returns:
        Null if the method unblocked due to some other reason.

      • write

        Will write to a stream the result of getMessages(), using a MessageFormatter implementation of its own choosing. Will close the stream.
        Parameters:
        stream - Target.
        Returns:
        True if written, false otherwise.

      • mergeWith

        MergingFollower mergeWith(CommonFollower f)
        Merge this CommonFollower with another. This CommonFollower has a responsibility of notifying the resulting MergingFollower of every Message that it receives, until such time that MergingFollower.separate(Follower) is called on it.
        Parameters:
        f - To merge with.
        Returns:
        A new MergingFollower, that will merge both CommonFollowers. If any of the CommonFollowers already is a MergingFollower, the returned instance will hold every merged CommonFollower individually and not compose MergingFollowers.
